data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
All instructions are the same. There are three directions. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point, you follow the same procedure. Turning around and turning right make the circle same. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around and taking 10 steps equals that amount of steps you took when you started the direction. 6 steps equals 6 steps taken twice. 4 steps equals 4 steps taken twice. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and take 5 steps. If you follow the instructions, you will go back up to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning left will bring you back to the starting point. Walking back around will take you back. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and turn. On your way to the starting point, turn left, turn right, take 7 steps and turn around. Once you return to the starting point, turn left, turn right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If one does these exercises, one assumes that one has jumped into the right lane of the road and had to return to the starting point at 8 mph. If one had jumped out to the left lane and had to take 8 steps, one assumed that one had to take 9 steps. So, the answer is yes.

Turning around requires 18 steps and 6 steps are on one side of a square. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Facing forward helps you keep your head straight and your body weight on your forefinger. If you take 1 step left, the direction your head should be facing is forward. Facing forward helps you keep your body weight on your forefinger and your forefinger should be tilted in a left angle. If you take 4 steps forward, the direction your head should be facing is forward. If you walk straight, the direction your body is facing is to the left. So, the answer is Yes.

You can’ t take 4 steps right without facing right. The directions only mention facing forward. A person is facing forward and should always point his or her eyes upward. So, the answer is No.

If you are facing forward, you do not often return to your starting point. If you are facing downwards, your starting point is in the middle of your path. If you take four steps backward, instead of 3 steps left, you take 4, not 3. If you take 3 steps left, instead of 6, you take 1.
